section_purpose: To summarize the paper's core contribution: a new probabilistic-method Graph Neural Network (GNN) model for learning branching heuristics to enhance backtracking algorithms, with demonstrated efficacy on the (minimum) dominating-clique problem.
key_points: Backtracking is central to AI problems like constraint satisfaction and combinatorial optimization.
The paper proposes a new GNN model designed using the probabilistic method to learn branching heuristics.
The GNN learns probability distributions over graph vertices, from which a branching heuristic is extracted for use in backtracking search.
Experiments on the (minimum) dominating-clique problem show the learned heuristic outperforms the minimum-remaining-values heuristic in reducing the number of search tree branches.
The work presents a novel application of GNNs to improve classical backtracking algorithms.

algorithms: Graph Neural Network (GNN) model designed via probabilistic method
Backtracking algorithm enhanced with learned branching heuristic
